senses.synonym: 01052111-n (concealment that attempts to prevent something scandalous from becoming public)

relations.target: mistake=00071785-n (a wrong action attributable to bad judgment or ignorance or inattention; \""he made a bad mistake\""; \""she was quick to point out my errors\""; \""I could understand his English in spite of his grammatical faults\"");05904330-n (an understanding of something that is not correct; \""he wasn't going to admit his mistake\""; \""make no mistake about his intentions\""; \""there must be some misunderstanding--I don't have a sister\"");06782183-n (part of a statement that is not correct; \""the book was full of errors\"");00619438-v (to make a mistake or be incorrect);00619957-v (identify incorrectly; \""Don't mistake her for her twin sister\""
wrongdoing=00734044-n (activity that transgresses moral or civil law; \""he denied any wrongdoing\"");04860996-n (departure from what is ethically acceptable

disguise=02163017-v (make unrecognizable; \""The herb masks the garlic taste\""; \""We disguised our faces before robbing the bank\"");01051190-n (the act of concealing the identity of something by modifying its appearance; \""he is a master of disguise\"");03211439-n (any attire that modifies the appearance in order to conceal the wearer's identity);04686431-n (an outward semblance that misrepresents the true nature of something; \""the theatrical notion of disguise is always associated with catastrophe in his stories\""
conceal=02149298-v (prevent from being seen or discovered; \""hide the money\"");02151220-v (hold back; keep from being perceived by others; \""She conceals her anger well\""

senses.definition: An attempt to conceal or disguise a wrongdoing or a mistake.
